summary: This is an email chain from September 2021, forwarding earlier communications. The core email from October 2019 describes a victim's meeting in New York where a journalist, Kate Briquelet, made inquiries, and Dawn Schneider, a PR representative for David Boies, was actively recruiting victims for a Glamour Magazine story. The email sender expresses concern about the ethical problems of this recruitment during an official meeting.

persons.name: Kate Briquelet
persons.context: A journalist from The Daily Beast who contacted the email sender with suggestive questions about the victims meeting, co-conspirators, and the FBI investigation.

persons.name: Dawn Schneider
persons.context: PR for David Boies; attended the victims meeting, introduced the sender to Kate Briquelet, and actively recruited victims to participate in a Glamour Magazine story she was orchestrating.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: An attorney; Dawn Schneider is identified as his PR representative.

persons.name: Ms. Allred
persons.context: Represented another victim who was at the meeting; the email sender spoke to this victim.

connections.description: Dawn Schneider is identified as the PR representative for attorney David Boies.
Dawn Schneider had introduced the email sender to journalist Kate Briquelet in July prior to the October meeting.
Dawn Schneider, through the email sender, attempted to recruit a victim represented by Ms. Allred for a Glamour Magazine story.

events.title: Victims Meeting in New York
events.description: A meeting for victims was held. During/after the meeting, Dawn Schneider recruited attendees for a Glamour Magazine story, and journalist Kate Briquelet contacted a participant with questions.

events.title: Email Forward Regarding Victims Meeting
events.description: An email from October 25, 2019, describing the victims meeting was forwarded, indicating ongoing discussion of the event.

events.title: Email Chain Forwarding Discovery Communications
events.description: A series of emails regarding 'Epstein/Maxwell Discovery' were forwarded among FBI and victim services personnel.

keyFacts: A victims meeting in New York in October 2019 was the subject of media inquiry by Daily Beast journalist Kate Briquelet.
Dawn Schneider, PR for attorney David Boies, used the victims meeting to recruit attendees for a Glamour Magazine story, which the email sender found problematic and unethical.
The email chain from 2021 shows this 2019 communication was part of the discovery process in the Epstein/Maxwell case.
The sender specifically notes being asked by Dawn Schneider to encourage other victims to attend the Glamour story, indicating a coordinated PR effort among victims.
